The energy of the collision of billions of charged particles causes the increase of internal energy and therefore intense heat. Kinetic energy turns to heat and this heat causes the emission of photons thanks to the excitement of the electrons. Light bulbs emit photons for the same reason: the electric current makes the tungsten atoms vibrate very rapidly and at a certain point they give out light. We're still talking about incandescence.

Because of the Lorentz force, Earth's magnetic field attracts every charged particle(negative or positive)to its north and south poles(NOT coinciding with the geographical poles).The curved lines of the magnetic field indicate that each electric charge is attracted to the poles that are the original point of these lines.
